snippet: Rather than use a conventional all-wheel-drive transfer case, Ferrari bolts two transmissions to the FF’s engine, drawing torque from the front and rear of the crankshaft to drive, respectively, the front and rear wheels.
lead_paragraph: Rather than use a conventional all-wheel-drive transfer case, Ferrari bolts two transmissions to the FF’s engine, drawing torque from the front and rear of the crankshaft to drive, respectively, the front and rear wheels.
